Header: Joint Opposition inquires US embassy about SOFA
Content: The Joint opposition accuses that the SOFA agreement permits the US army to act without any hindrance in Sri Lanka. Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena expressed this view at a media briefing convened by its Economic Research unit in Colombo this morning. However, The U.S. envoy in Colombo has said The United States has no plan or intention to establish a US base in Sri Lanka. US Ambassador to Sri Lanka Alaina B. Teplitz in a Twitter post dismissed recent reports published in media on the draft of the Status of Forces Agreement as "blatant misinformation". Teplitz said Visiting Forces Agreement negotiations only aim to facilitate cooperation and any agreement will fully respect the sovereignty of Sri Lanka.
